data.title: Unpack Tuesday Weld Net Worth & Career Success 2024
data.meta_description: Explore Tuesday Weld net worth in 2024 with insights by RachelParris. Learn about her career earnings, financial milestones, and legacy at RachelParris.com.
data.text:
Curious about Tuesday Weld Net Worth? As one of the wealthiest women in television, Tuesday’s financial milestones are a testament to a storied career.

This introduction delves into the financial aspects of her life, offering a glimpse of her successes and the factors that influenced her earnings.

Quick Facts

FACTDETAILReal NameSusan Ker WeldPopular NameTuesday WeldGenderFemaleBirth DateAugust 27, 1943Age80ParentsLathrop Motley Weld, Yosene Balfour KerSiblingsSarah King Weld, David Balfour WeldBirthplaceNew York City, New York, United StatesNationalityAmericanEthnicityN/AEducationHollywood High School, Professional Children’s School, Hollywood Professional SchoolMarital StatusDivorcedSexual OrientationStraightWife/SpousePinchas Zukerman (m. 1985–1998), Dudley Moore (m. 1975–1980), Claude Harz (m. 1965–1971)ChildrenPatrick H. Moore, Natasha HarzDatingN/ANet Worth$5 millionSource of WealthActingHeight5 ft 3 in (1.61 m)

What is the Net Worth of Tuesday Weld in 2024?

Weld’s net worth in 2024 is $5 million. Compared to other actresses from her era, like Shirley Jones ($25 million) and Ann-Margret ($25 million), Weld’s net worth is more modest.

However, her strategic career choices and iconic roles in films and television have ensured a stable financial status.

Despite not reaching the same financial heights as some of her peers, Weld’s $5 million net worth reflects her successful and enduring career in Hollywood.

Major Film Roles and Earnings

Tuesday Weld‘s career skyrocketed with significant roles in classic films. Notable among these are Pretty Poison, Looking for Mr. Goodbar, Thief, and Once Upon a Time in America.

These roles didn’t just earn her critical acclaim but also substantial financial rewards. Each film added to her growing net worth, bolstered by her Golden Globe Award win and Academy Award nomination.

Television Career and Earnings

In addition to her film success, Weld made a mark on television. Her role as Thalia Menninger in The Many Loves of Dobie Gillis remains iconic.

The earnings from her television career significantly contributed to her financial status, cementing her as a versatile actress in both mediums.

Awards and Recognitions

Weld’s career is adorned with numerous awards and recognitions. Winning a Golden Globe and receiving an Academy Award nomination not only boosted her career but also her net worth.

These accolades highlight her talent and the financial impact of her award-winning performances.

Personal Life and Financial Management

Her personal life has seen its share of highs and lows, including three marriages and two children, Patrick H. Moore and Natasha Harz.

Despite the challenges, she managed her finances wisely. Her decisions in financial management played a crucial role in maintaining her wealth.

Later Career and Current Financial Status

As her career progressed, Weld took on fewer roles, but each was impactful. Her later works, including her role in Once Upon a Time in America, continued to add to her net worth.

Today, she remains financially stable, with a mix of investments and residuals from her past work.

Legacy and Influence in Hollywood

Her legacy in Hollywood is undeniable. Her influence spans decades, inspiring future generations of actors.

Her career choices, from child star to award-winning actress, continue to be a benchmark for success. This enduring influence contributes to her net worth, reflecting her lasting impact on the industry.

Social Media Accounts

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/realtuesdayweld/ (2.023 Followers)

FAQs about Tuesday Weld

When did Tuesday Weld start her acting career?

She began her acting career at the age of 12. She started as a child model and quickly transitioned into acting, making her film debut in Rock, Rock, Rock! in 1956.

What are some of her most famous roles?

Some of her most notable roles include Thalia Menninger in The Many Loves of Dobie Gillis, Kitty in Looking for Mr. Goodbar, Sue Ann Stepanek in Pretty Poison, and Carol in Thief.

Has she won any major awards?

Yes, she won a Golden Globe Award for Most Promising Female Newcomer in 1960. She was also nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her role in Looking for Mr. Goodbar in 1979.

What was Weld’s early life like?

She faced a challenging early life. Her father passed away when she was young, and she had to support her family through modeling and acting from a very early age.

How tall is Tuesday Weld?

She is 5 feet 4 inches (1.63 meters) tall.

How old is Tuesday Weld?

As of May 2024, she is 80 years old.

Did she have any significant relationships?

She had several notable relationships, including a brief and tumultuous marriage to British actor Dudley Moore. They married in 1975 but divorced in 1980. She was also married to writer Claude Harz and violinist Pinchas Zukerman.

Why did she take a hiatus from acting?

She took a hiatus from acting in the late 1990s to focus on her personal life. She stepped away from the spotlight to enjoy a quieter existence, which she has maintained ever since.

What impact did she have on Hollywood?

She left a significant mark on Hollywood with her versatile performances and unique presence. She inspired many aspiring actors and remains a cherished figure in the industry.

Is Tuesday Weld still acting?

She has largely retired from acting, with her last major role being in the late 1990s. She has since chosen to lead a more private life away from the public eye.

Conclusion

Tuesday Weld’s financial journey is both inspiring and educational. As we explore her wealth accumulation over the years, it becomes clear how her roles have solidified her status among television’s elite.
